projects.name: Planning Permissions Portal
projects.description: Design & Development of a planning permissions platform, written in Angular, Python and Node.JS hosted on AWS
tasks: Developed an event-driven, serverless microservices application on AWS
Followed Domain-Driven Design principles to reduce complexity of the system
Developed business critical components using TDD approach to reduce bugs and increase confidence in refactoring code
Led event-storming sessions with the client to extract the business domain ubiquitous language and identify bounded contexts
Reduced coupling between microservices using EventBridge bus for asynchronous communication between microservices
Developed a serverless scraper using Scrapy, Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, S3, Docker triggered by CloudWatch events
Designed the data model using DynamoDB Single-Table design pattern
Developed a service to ingest different types of documents (DOCX, PDF, emails) into Elasticsearch
Built an OCR service using Lambda and custom Docker image with the Tesseract OCR python library
Developed an advanced planning applications search engine using an Elasticsearch cluster hosted on ElasticCloud
Developed an email based notification system, giving users the ability to track planning permissions updates
Developed a frontend application written in Angular, hosted on AWS using the Amplify framework
Developed a backend API written in Node.js, AWS Lambda, API Gateway
Implemented JWT authentication with 2FA using AWS Cognito user pools

Database query optimization

summary: Hi! I'm Mohamed, I'm a full-stack software developer with more than 5 years of experience developing and maintaining web apps, APIs, scrapers on the cloud. As a passionate programmer, I love building things and turn ideas into reality, I’ve joined up on multiple occasions with cross-disciplinary team members, where we developed prize-winning ideas within 24 hours in hackathons. I’ve written software for different kinds of things, like IoT devices, small games, web, and mobile apps.
